trans-unit.source: Azure Service Configuration Schema (.cscfg File)
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Configuration Schema (.cscfg File)

trans-unit.source: The service configuration file specifies the number of role instances to deploy for each role in the service, the values of any configuration settings, and the thumbprints for any certificates associated with a role.
trans-unit.target: The service configuration file specifies the number of role instances to deploy for each role in the service, the values of any configuration settings, and the thumbprints for any certificates associated with a role.

trans-unit.source: If the service is part of a Virtual Network, configuration information for the network must be provided in the service configuration file, as well as in the virtual networking configuration file.
trans-unit.target: If the service is part of a Virtual Network, configuration information for the network must be provided in the service configuration file, as well as in the virtual networking configuration file.

trans-unit.source: The default extension for the service configuration file is .cscfg.
trans-unit.target: The default extension for the service configuration file is .cscfg.

trans-unit.source: The service model is described by the <link xlink:href="b7735dbf-8e91-4d1b-89f7-2f17e9302469" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Definition Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: The service model is described by the <link xlink:href="b7735dbf-8e91-4d1b-89f7-2f17e9302469" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Definition Schema</link>.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Azure Diagnostics configuration schema file is installed to the <codeInline>C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Windows Azure\.NET SDK\%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;\schemas</codeInline> directory.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Azure Diagnostics configuration schema file is installed to the <codeInline>C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Windows Azure\.NET SDK\%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;\schemas</codeInline> directory.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the installed version of the <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/downloads/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;version%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the installed version of the <externalLink><linkText>Azure SDK</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/downloads/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring roles in a service, see <externalLink><linkText>How To: Configure the Roles for an Azure Application with Visual Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/hh369931.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring roles in a service, see <externalLink><linkText>How To: Configure the Roles for an Azure Application with Visual Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/hh369931.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Basic Service Configuration Schema
trans-unit.target: Basic Service Configuration Schema

trans-unit.source: The basic format of the service configuration file is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The basic format of the service configuration file is as follows.

trans-unit.source: Schema definitions
trans-unit.target: Schema definitions

trans-unit.source: The following topics describe the schema for the <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element:
trans-unit.target: The following topics describe the schema for the <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element:

trans-unit.source: Service Configuration Namespace
trans-unit.target: Service Configuration Namespace

trans-unit.source: The XML namespace for the service configuration file is:
trans-unit.target: The XML namespace for the service configuration file is:

trans-unit.source: ServiceConfiguration Element
trans-unit.target: ServiceConfiguration Element

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element is the top-level element of the service configuration file.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element is the top-level element of the service configuration file.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the attributes of the <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: All attributes values are string types.
trans-unit.target: All attributes values are string types.

trans-unit.source: Attribute
trans-unit.target: Attribute

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: serviceName
trans-unit.target: serviceName

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The name of the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The name given here must match the name specified in the service definition file.
trans-unit.target: The name given here must match the name specified in the service definition file.

trans-unit.source: osFamily
trans-unit.target: osFamily

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Guest OS that will run on role instances in the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Guest OS that will run on role instances in the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For information about supported Guest OS releases, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about supported Guest OS releases, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: If you do not include an <languageKeyword>osFamily</languageKeyword> value and you have not set the <languageKeyword>osVersion</languageKeyword> attribute to a specific Guest OS version, a default value of 1 is used.
trans-unit.target: If you do not include an <languageKeyword>osFamily</languageKeyword> value and you have not set the <languageKeyword>osVersion</languageKeyword> attribute to a specific Guest OS version, a default value of 1 is used.

trans-unit.source: osVersion
trans-unit.target: osVersion

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the Guest OS that will run on role instances in the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the Guest OS that will run on role instances in the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Guest OS versions, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Guest OS versions, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can specify that the Guest OS should be automatically upgraded to the latest version.
trans-unit.target: You can specify that the Guest OS should be automatically upgraded to the latest version.

trans-unit.source: To do this, set the value of the <languageKeyword>osVersion</languageKeyword> attribute to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To do this, set the value of the <languageKeyword>osVersion</languageKeyword> attribute to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: When set to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword>, the role instances are deployed using the latest version of the Guest OS for the specified OS family and will be automatically upgraded when new versions of the Guest OS are released.
trans-unit.target: When set to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword>, the role instances are deployed using the latest version of the Guest OS for the specified OS family and will be automatically upgraded when new versions of the Guest OS are released.

trans-unit.source: To specify a specific version manually, use the <languageKeyword>Configuration String</languageKeyword> from the table in the <embeddedLabel>Future, Current and Transitional Guest OS Versions</embeddedLabel> section of <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To specify a specific version manually, use the <languageKeyword>Configuration String</languageKeyword> from the table in the <embeddedLabel>Future, Current and Transitional Guest OS Versions</embeddedLabel> section of <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The default value for the <languageKeyword>osVersion</languageKeyword> attribute is <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The default value for the <languageKeyword>osVersion</languageKeyword> attribute is <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: schemaVersion
trans-unit.target: schemaVersion

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the Service Configuration schema.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the Service Configuration schema.

trans-unit.source: The schema version allows Visual Studio to select the correct SDK tools to use for schema validation if more than one version of the SDK is installed side-by-side.
trans-unit.target: The schema version allows Visual Studio to select the correct SDK tools to use for schema validation if more than one version of the SDK is installed side-by-side.

trans-unit.source: For more information about schema and version compatibility, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: For more information about schema and version compatibility, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: The service configuration file must contain one <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The service configuration file must contain one <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element may include any number of <languageKeyword>Role</languageKeyword> elements and zero or 1 <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> elements.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ServiceConfiguration</languageKeyword> element may include any number of <languageKeyword>Role</languageKeyword> elements and zero or 1 <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> elements.
